meanings.definition: Gaults: a type of heavy clay soil
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted his crops in the rich gaults of the field.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers dug through the gaults to lay the foundation.
meanings.sent3: The children had a playful mud fight in the gaults, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The gaults held onto the roots of the trees like a firm grip on the earth.
meanings.sent5: The gaults were so sticky that it was hard to walk through them.

meanings.definition: Gaults: to cover with a layer of gaults
meanings.sent1: She carefully gaults the walls to protect them from the harsh weather.
meanings.sent2: The workers gault the roof to prevent leaks during the rainy season.
meanings.sent3: He gaults the cake with a thick layer of frosting, making it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The artist gaults the canvas with vibrant colors, bringing the painting to life.
meanings.sent5: The gardener gaults the plants with mulch to help them grow strong and healthy.

meanings.definition: Gaults: a person who gaults, especially professionally
meanings.sent1: The skilled gaults repaired the damaged walls with precision.
meanings.sent2: The experienced gaults were called in to renovate the historic building.
meanings.sent3: The gaults joked about their muddy profession, sharing stories of their work.
meanings.sent4: She was a true gaults, always ready to take on challenging projects.
meanings.sent5: The dedicated gaults worked tirelessly to perfect their craft.
